message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.SY, cs.CV

This paper deals with the problem of designing reward signals for agents in game playing scenarios, which is a common topic in the field of artificial intelligence (AI). Therefore, cs.AI is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a new algorithm for Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS), which is a popular algorithm for solving Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), and compares it to various other MCTS variants. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (machine learning), cs.GT (game theory), and cs.SY (systems and control). Finally, the paper uses the General Video Game Playing (GVGP) framework to evaluate the proposed algorithm, which involves analyzing game states and making decisions based on visual input, suggesting that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.CV (computer vision).
